results.title: The Story of Chinese art (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A survey of Chinese art from the unknown beginning of modern times. The influence of Central Asia, India and Europe on Chinese culture, as well as the influence of China on her Asiatic neighbours, the Near East and the West are shown.
results.description: A survey of Chinese art from the unknown beginning of modern times. The influence of Central Asia, India and Europe on Chinese culture, as well as the influence of China on her Asiatic neighbours, the Near East and the West are shown.

results.title: The Story of cement
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the manufacture and variety of uses of cement in constructions such as dams, bridges, highways, buildings and swimming pools.

results.title: The Story of Carl Gustav Jung. Part 3: The Mystery that heals
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Part three of a three part series on the work and life of Carl Gustav Jung, the pioneer of modern psychology. Deals with his life and philosophy in his later years; discusses his attitudes toward Christianity and death as well as the concept of “shadow”. Includes interviews with Aniela Jaffe, editor of his autobiography, and C.A. Meier, a former colleague. Contains some b&w footage. Presented by Laurens Van der Post who knew Jung from 1946 until his death in 1961.

results.title: The Story of Carl Gustav Jung. Part 2: 67,000 dreams
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Part two of a three part series on the work and life of Carl Gustav Jung, the pioneer of modern psychology. Explains the development of his major theories and concepts and examines his life from the age of forty onwards. Points out that Jung had psychoanalysed 67,000 dreams by this stage and had also written several works on psychoanalysis. Contains some b&w footage. Presented by Laurens Van der Post who knew the Jung from 1946 until his death in 1961.

results.title: The Story of Carl Gustav Jung. Part 1: In search of the soul
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Part one of a three part series on the work and life of Carl Gustav Jung, the pioneer of modern psychology. Examines his childhood, student years and early career including Jung’s struggle with religion; his discovery that institutionalising the mentally ill did not necessarily produce the best outcome; his marriage in 1903; his initial relationship with Freud and interest in things normality rejects. Contains some b&w footage. Presented by Laurens Van der Post who knew Jung from 1946 until his death in 1961

results.title: The Story of Canberra
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the events which led to federation and eventual selection of the Australian Capital Territory and Canberra as its capital city. Traces the history, landmarks, life of the people, and functions as the centre of the Australian Government Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: The Story of aviation
results.creator_credit: Brendan Geraghty, Dave Flitton, Lamancha and Castle Communications
results.brief_description: The dawn of the 20th Century was the dawn of the air age. Aviation, originally a novelty, became an integral part of modern life, its foundations laid by early pioneers. This program celebrates the magnificent men of flight’s first decades with historic archival footage of their triumphs and tragedies. Profiles the military development of the aeroplane during both World Wars, the peacetime Golden era of civilian aviation progress with the North Atlantic Crossing, Charles Lindbergh’s solo flight, the Schneider Trophy competition, the shrinking world with the development of rotary wings, rocket power and early forms of jet propulsion, and the crash of the Hindenburg passenger airship.

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Agnes Karlik
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

results.title: The Story of a writer
results.creator_credit: Terry Sanders and David L Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: Portrays the life, attitudes and method of work of a creative writer. Ray Bradbury discusses his experience and views and traces the process of writing the story Dial Double Zero, which is dramatised in condensed form. Cast: Bill Joyce. Narrated by John Willis.

results.title: The Story of a violin
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows how a violin is made in story form. When Bill’s violin gets broken in a tussle, it is the beginning of a fascinating experience for him and his friends. They discover how a violin-maker cuts and fits, sandpapers and polishes, until, three months after he began the work, a new, glossy violin is ready for Bill to apply his bow and draw out a tune. Covers the types of wood used and their origins, the tools required and list the main sections and components of a violin. Includes a violin assemblage sequence animated by Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart. Photography by Harold Berk. Editing and sound by Eugene Kash.
